Title: Research Associate
Description:
About the Job
        
                Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Research AssociateCenter for Transportation & Logistics The MIT Center for Transportation & Logistics seeks a research associate to lead, supervise, and contribute directly to the research and development activities needed to build and grow its newly formed Visual Analytics Lab. We seek applicants who are enthusiastic about making groundbreaking ideas for the next generation of interactive, audio-visual user interfaces and experiences a reality with state-of-the-art visualization technology, including AR, VR, and MR systems. You should enjoy working independently, setting yourself ambitious goals to make such ideas happen in a team of highly motivated and skilled experts from various fields. You are motivated by and comfortable with a high level of creative freedom and control to create innovative, powerful, methodologically rigorous and effective, while at the same time visually and perceptionally appealing user experiences. You are looking for an inspiring and motivating environment to challenge and grow your ideas around visual analytics and to bring them to life with the help of state-of-the-art, largescale smart screen, AR, VR, and MR technology. You strive to develop and implement the methods and tools required to reap the full potential of interactive 2D and 3D visualization in turning challenging, data-driven decision problems and large-scale data analytics, simulation and optimization models of all kinds into engaging, high-fidelity, immersive audio-visual experiences. Moreover, you are willing and able to help to develop opportunities for new research projects and initiatives by presenting the lab’s work to audiences of all kinds, including potential new sponsors.  Responsibilities: ·        Assume the technical development lead of the lab’s activities in designing immersive, audio-visual human-machine interfaces that support the use of advanced algorithms, Big Data analytics, and mathematical modelling in collaborative, interdisciplinary research, decision making, and teaching·        Research, develop, and implement new methods and algorithms to engage humans as an active, cognitive element in research, data analytics, and decision making at the intersect of statistical inference, machine learning, large-scale simulation and optimization modeling, and innovative data visualization·        Explore innovative ways of utilizing interactive visualization in the data analytics process, building on sensor-equipped conventional display technologies as well as quickly advancing augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), and mixed reality (MR) technologies·        Work with internal and external collaborators·        Supervise and cosupervise software engineers and other lab employees as needed·        Develop opportunities for new research projects and initiatives by presenting the lab’s work to audiences of all kinds, including potential new sponsors·        Demonstrate and disseminate the lab’s work to the public·        Support and cosupervise student involvement in lab projects·        Actively engage thought leaders and relevant stakeholder groups to move ideas around visual analytics to action and application in various fields, from supply chain and logistics, to urban planning, to economics, to data science·        Other duties as requested  Required qualifications: ·        Master’s degree in computer science or a related field·        Proven track record of developing innovative software applications for high-performance, interactive-visualization·        Sound theoretical and initial practical experience in the field of computer graphics related to the development of interactive, visual user interfaces and experiences (UI/UX) leveraging conventional, touch-enabled, and sensor-equipped display methods·        Proficiency and substantial experience in front-end software development for conventional audio-visual user interfaces, including tools such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or suitable equivalents.·        Relevant initial experience with software development for 2D and/or 3D graphical user interfaces, including development environments such as Visual Studio and Unity or suitable equivalents·        At least three years of experience programming in Python or a comparable high-level language ·        Initial experience in back-end software development, including tools such as PHP, SQL, Node.js, Angular.js, or suitable equivalents·        Ability and willingness to quickly learn new programming/scripting languages as needed·        Sound familiarity with advanced methods of data science and mathematical modeling·        Solid project management capabilities for software development and a high degree of independence, self-motivation, and organization·        Desire to work in a collaborative, team-oriented environment with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers, developers, and students at all levels of seniority and experience and to cosupervise and guide the work of software engineers and undergraduate and graduate students contributing to the research and development efforts of the lab  Preferred Qualifications: ·        Ph.D. in computer science or related field·        Experience with software development in C++, C# and/or Java·        Experience developing software applications for interactive user experiences with AR/VR/MR technology.·        Theoretical knowledge and basic experience managing computational complexity to optimize the efficiency and performance of advanced algorithms in order to create high-performing, scalable computational systems·        Substantial experience developing code that processes and organizes data stored in professional-grade relational databases (PostgreSQL or MySQL) or data warehouses·        Initial theoretical and practical experience with human-computer interaction for improved UI/UX design·        Particular interest in the development of novel methods for voice, gesture, touch based commands and other interfaces for humans to interact intuitively with scientific models, data, and visualizations to create an immersive environment for human-centric research, analysis, and decision making  Interested candidates may apply on-line at  https://careers.mit.edu .  Please reference job number 15175 and indicate where you saw this posting.   MIT is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.

Title: Senior/Lead Architect - Computer Vision/Image Processing
Description:
About the Job
        
                We are a Stealth mode startup based in Fremont that is developing a revolutionary storage and compute acceleration platform using deep learning and machine learning.  Our platform runs on standard hardware and handles low-level implementation details so data scientists/developers can be more productive!  The platform can scale to thousands of FPGA and ASIC devices and can virtualize the computer power required for cloud scale applications.Top Reasons to Work with UsWe are seeking a technical lead and architect/designer for solving computer vision problems on FPGAs/ASICs. Title: Solutions Architect - Deep Learning
Description:
About the Job
        
                We are looking for a Solutions Architect based in the metro Washington, DC area. Our Solution Architects are drawn from elite developers and scientists and enjoy working with the latest in GPU hardware and software. At NVIDIA, you will be able to develop your knowledge of GPUs for high-performance analytics across a range of applications from signal processing to deep learning.The Solution Architect works with key NVIDIA customers in the Federal, Commercial and Education areas. We enable our customers to execute projects with compelling productivity breakthroughs. You will work with some of the most highly regarded organizations in the Federal ecosystem, and your work will bring the latest technology to mission critical workflows, contributing to the enhanced safety, security and economic capability of our country.A Solution Architect is the first line of technical expertise between NVIDIA and our partners and customers. The duties vary from building software for proof-of-concept demonstrations, to driving relationships with key executives and managers in order to evangelize accelerated computing. You will engage with developers, scientific researchers, data scientists, IT managers and senior leaders.As an NVIDIA Solution Architect, you will support our Technical Account Managers with their lighthouse accounts. You will help drive new business in those accounts and in new accounts. You will lead the technical relationship with your lighthouse accounts and assist your customers with building innovative solutions based on NVIDIA technology. You will be an authority on integrating NVIDIA technology into applications built on Deep Learning, Graph Analytics, Signal Processing and other state-of-the-art technologies.As Solution Architects we write technical blog articles and give seminars on parallel programming, deep learning and data analytics using NVIDIA products. You will also be an internal champion for Data Analytics and Machine Learning among the NVIDIA technical community. Do you enjoy being involved in multiple, diverse technical projects at the same time and appreciate a fast paced, constantly changing and challenging work experience?NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you.What we need to see:3+ years experience developing machine learning, computer vision or data analytics work flows.Experience implementing Deep Learning applications with one or more of the major DL frameworks, such as Caffe, TensorFlow, or Torch.Extraordinary verbal and written communication skills, and an enthusiastic presentation style.Ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day direction.Healthy collaboration and social skills.C/C++/Python/Java/Scala programming experienceExperience with GPU computing and CUDA programmingExperience using scale-out cloud and/or HPC architectures for parallel programmingBS in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Neuroscience, Experimental Psychology or equivalent work experience.Ways to stand out from the crowd:Significant Deep Learning experience with government customer problem domains.The ability to hold a US DOD security clearance.CUDA optimization experience using NVIDIA’s parallel Nsight tools.Extensive experience designing and deploying large scale HPC and enterprise computing systems.Deep knowledge of the market and ecosystem around a specific federal government department or agency.MS or PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Neuroscience, Experimental Psychology or equivalent work experience.Published record of thought leadership in a technical area or industry segment.#deeplearningNVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Analytics
Sector: Computer Software; Healthcare Services; Medical Devices and Suppli
Description:
About the Job
        
                The Agfa-Gevaert Group develops, produces and distributes an extensive range of analog and digital imaging systems and IT solutions, mainly for the printing industry and the healthcare sector, as well as for specific industrial applications.Job description: Agfa HealthCare, a member of the Agfa-Gevaert Group, is a leading global provider of diagnostic imaging and healthcare IT solutions. The company has nearly a century of healthcare experience and has been a pioneer on the healthcare IT market since the early 1990's. Today, Agfa HealthCare designs, develops and delivers state-of-the-art systems for capturing, managing and processing diagnostic images and clinical/administrative information for hospitals and healthcare facilities, as well as contrast media solutions to enable effective medical imaging results. The company has sales offices and agents in over 100 markets worldwide. Join our clinical analytics team and help to transform the medical imaging industry through extracting value from clinical data. In this position, you will work on and drive forward clinical and imaging analytics, utilizing tenets and methodologies of artificial intelligence, machine learning, data mining, and more in achieving this goal. You will work with both structured and unstructured data to drive clinical applications to augment clinician workflow and drive higher degrees of efficiency and effectiveness. You will be responsible for providing design guidance, and utilizing state of the art techniques through writing code to implement functionality using prescribed software development tools and processes to meet business goals.  Under minimal supervision, you will be responsible for managing assignments in a proficient and professional manner.  You will work in an agile environment and interface directly with individuals in product management, development, marketing, testing and service departments and across geographical boundaries to ensure that the goals of the software release phase are met. This position will be based out of the following location(s) and surrounding areaCanton, MA RESPONSIBILITIES: Work collaboratively with software development peers and cross-functional counterparts to ensure that relevant information is communicated in a timely and comprehensible manner to satisfy the goals of the production cycle.  Proactive communication with individuals and managers in the roles of design control, resource management, and business planning.Analyze and interpret large amounts of global and annotated data assets, and articulate clinical insights in a clear and consistent manner. Report complex analytics results in terms that are meaningful to business leaders and customers.Demonstrate an understanding of clinical data and concepts in the healthcare domainEnsure that work products meet all requisite software development practices and sanctioned production processes including the creation of regulatory artifacts.Acquire, share, and apply knowledge of standards, tools and technology with a focus on pragmatic application to business prioritized software solutions.Monitor ongoing developments in the machine learning and medical imaging industries to leverage industry breakthroughs.Apply deep learning, computer vision, and/or natural language processing algorithms to help solve problems of working with unstructured and/or image-based real-world clinical data and supercharge clinical workflows.  Seeked profile:QUALIFICATIONS:RequiredA passion for data analytics.Strong programming skills using PythonBackground in machine learning and deep learning with hands-on experience with common frameworks and tools like Keras, TensorFlow, Theano, etc.Background in computer vision or natural language processing.Experience in medical imaging or HIT industries and have worked with clinical data.Experience working on teams that utilize Scrum as their Agile approach to software developmentDegree in Computer Science/ Engineering/Data Science/Machine Learning or a related field. Masters of PhD a plus.A minimum of 5-6 year software development experience working in a team environment and extensive background in applying these skills in a technical lead role preferred. PreferredExperience with R, Java, Apache Spark, BigQuery, Visualization toolsFamiliarity with SNOMEDKnowledge of RDF, OWLKnowledge of the industry standards for software development in the healthcare industry is a plus (such as the DICOM Standard, HIPAA regulations, etc.)Experience with crowdsourcing platforms (Mechanical Turk, Crowdflower, etc.)We offer a rewarding career in a field that impacts lives, the opportunity to work with a talented and  committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of this experience, we'll take you there!Learn more about Agfa HealthCare and follow us on Twitter.Agfa HealthCare Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

Description:
About the Job
        
                A career at Data Sciences International, Inc. ("DSI") is an experience where employees are energized and aligned by our purpose – To improve lives through technology, innovation, passion and the power of information. At DSI our core values are more than just words, they’re a way of life.  We know companies with a strong culture and a higher purpose perform better in the long run.  As we continue to grow, we strive to ensure our culture remains alive and well.  Our core values; Integrity, Innovation and Inspiration.At DSI, anything worth doing is worth doing with WOW.  To differentiate yourself, you must do something that is above and beyond what is expected.  And whatever you do should have an emotional impact on the receiver. We are not just an average company, our service is not average, and we don’t want our people to be average.  We expect every employee to deliver WOW.DSI is seeking a Senior Product Manager- Data Platform to fill a key role in leading DSI in the utilization of data analytics, data management, digital channels and techniques to accelerate discoveries in life science research. Title:  Back-end Insights Engineer                  Location: Portland, OR Area        Type:  Direct Hire        Job:  LS317538830              At InfoGroup Northwest, we use our deep technical insights, local market knowledge and rock-solid relationships and reputation to create exceptional business outcomes for people and companies every day. Position Scope:            Our client is seeking someone who can dive into their Python codebase managed by their “Insights” guild, which helps bridge the gap between the Data Sciences and Engineering teams. Title: Marketing Analytics Analyst
Description:
About the Job
        
                DescriptionACCOUNTABILITIES: • Leads and manages the development of a holistic cross-functional A&I point of view to address specified ad hoc cross-brand and/or cross-functional business questions that require the integration of output from marketing analytics, sales analytics, forecasting, decision science, and primarily market research. Creates value by adding own and synthesizing groups’ insights.• Works with senior staff managers to identify internal and external resource requirements and negotiates resources to meet ad hoc brand team needs. Works with Brand Director to make trade-offs in previous work plans to accommodate new project. • Represents any level of Sr. Management Staff as appropriate on internal committees or external team (e.g. business partners) meetings and communications. Suggests content for agendas, prepares and delivers presentations to address information needs and provides perspective to decisions at hand. • Leads the development and implementation of project plans for detailed, comprehensive secondary market data analyses across the portfolio in one of the following work streams: promotion response analytics, marketing mix modeling, segmentation schema, customer targeting or other related analyses. Recommends courses of action to support executive decision making in strategic business planning activities. • Maintains awareness of evolving analytical techniques, software and data sources to bring innovative approaches into the organization that drives higher quality results; designs and implements advanced secondary data analysis methodologies that provide best practices in these areas. • Functions independently as a “data scientist”; uses the scientific method to uncover business insights by asking challenging business questions, developing hypotheses around them, conducting data experiments, analyzing the results and drawing conclusions from the work to provide actionable intelligence to brand teams. • Prepares and delivers presentations with meaningful implications, actionable insights and recommendations which clearly delineate pros and cons to senior executive leadership in a timely manner. • Leads and conducts marketing analytics projects for multiple brand teams, and usually will support at least one brand marketed as part of an alliance partnership. • If outsourcing is appropriate, manages relationships with vendors on analytic plans, methodologies, and final deliverables. • Mentors analysts and associate analysts to ensure development of an appropriate skill set. set. • Able to use deep breadth of analytics and market knowledge to guide strategy decisions by brand directors and provide support for those decisions in discussions with senior executives. Demonstrates deep expertise in at least one brand and has the business framework to leverage knowledge base from all brand experiences to support other brands as necessary. Education and Experience: • BA or BS in an analytical field such as statistics, operations research, management science, industrial engineering, economics, math, etc. and 6+ years of quantitative experience or market research; or advanced degree in an analytical field such as statistics, operations research, management science, industrial engineering, economics, math, etc. and 4+ years of quantitative experience or market research. • 2+years pharmaceutical market research experience preferred. • Complete understanding and application of quantitative principles, concepts, practices, and standards surrounding the use and manipulation of secondary market data sources. • Extensive knowledge of market research principles and practices. • Extensive knowledge of industry practices. • Project planning and management skills. • Knowledge of coding techniques in SAS and VBA, and advanced Excel skills. • Excellent communication and presentation skills. • Vendor and budget management. • Basic people and team management skills including measuring and delivering performance feedback. • Resource Management; ability to manage internal and external resources (people, information, technologies, time, and capital); allocates resources appropriately, given organization, group and individual goals and objectives to align with business goals. • Proficient in one or more of MS Office, MS Access, VBA, SPSS, or SAS programming.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
About the Job
        
                OpportunityAbt Associates seeks a qualified Business Systems Analyst to support the Data Science, Surveys, and Enabling Technologies Division.The Business Systems Analyst will provide technology and business consulting services to the company’s diverse portfolio of projects.  Responsibilities include documenting, analyzing, and configuring information and communications technologies (ICT), which support the business processes and management information requirements of the company’s projects; analyzing and documenting business requirements, determining and validating acceptance criteria through system testing, and providing documentation and training.  The incumbent will also update staff on systems and procedural developments, provide insights into the appropriate application of technology, support internal and external proposals, and direct the work of systems analysts.The Business Systems Analyst will need to be able to support multiple initiatives at any one time of various levels of effort.  The scope of each project varies greatly from brief consulting sessions of less than one day to ongoing or recurring multi-year engagements resulting in thousands of cumulative hours.Key Roles and ResponsibilitiesAnalyzes business problems to determine appropriate technical and/or non-technical solutions. Serves as knowledgeable business resource to project staff in all phases of the development and implementation of new systems and process improvements.  This involves: (a) setting expectations of what can be realistically expected, (b) addressing issues of sustainability, (c) tying technology back to the ultimate project goals. Openly, respectfully, and convincingly share ideas and reservations with senior level staff.Elicits business requirements to document user stories. Defines acceptance criteria using business language and verifies code meets acceptance criteria using manual and automated testing procedures.Acts as liaison to system developers, product owners, and project management; establishes and prioritizes product backlog in partnership with the project team, documents the sprint/release plans, and facilitates meetings among technical team and larger project team.Works with developers as needed to develop detailed task estimates, provide explanation of user stories, and track completion against sprint plans.  May configure systems for prototyping or for final use.Documents existing business processes, and works within DSET to determine new or improved processes. Serves as a backstop for the configuration of various technology systems, including but not limited to Wordpress, Tableau, Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence), mobile data collection tools (ODK Collect, Commcare), and CRMs (Microsoft Dynamics, Insight.ly, Salesforce, ZohoCRM)Supports multiple initiatives at one time, appropriately balancing and prioritizing each effort while setting realistic expectations for a diverse set of stakeholders.Responsible for Quality Assurance - documenting any issues and ensuring errors are corrected.Preferred Skills / PrerequisitesCertified Scrum Master (CSM) preferred, or demonstrated experience working in an Agile Scrum teamAdept at identifying and drawing connections between project needs and potential technology solutionsHave capacity to adapt and thrive in diverse, unfamiliar, and challenging situationsProficient at learning new technologies and effectively incorporating into the work environment.Minimum QualificationsBachelor with 2 –4 years of experience OR the equivalent combination of education and experience.To apply visit: https://career4.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=51622&company=AbtPROD&username=

Title: IT Account Manager
Description:
About the Job
        
                System Soft Technologies is widely recognized for its professionalism, strong corporate morals, customer satisfaction, and effective business practices. We provide a full spectrum of business and IT services and solutions, including custom application development, enterprise solutions, systems integration, mobility solutions, and business information management. System Soft Technologies combines business domain knowledge with industry-specific practices and methodologies to offer unique solutions, and enable clients to compete with global standards. We find a client-centric approach and a passion for excellence is key in distinguishing ourselves from our competition and in accompanying you on your journey.  Job Summary:We are looking for a competitive and trustworthy Account Executive to help us grow our business activities within State Government Agencies. You will be responsible for discovering and pursuing new sales prospects and maintaining customer satisfaction. The goal is to meet and surpass the company’s expectations to drive rapid and sustainable growth. Required Duties and Responsibilities:Prospect and build new business opportunities with key decision makers and managers at targeted accounts through prospecting, education, client visits, presentations and relationship building. Accountable for meeting and/or exceeding assigned sales objectives and monthly revenue quotas, building new revenue through IT Solutions & services sales. Build and maintain accurate and up to date strategic account plans and revenue projections. Must be self-motivated and self-disciplined and provide prompt follow-up to all customer inquiries. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to present to both small and large groups.Must have polished, professional presentation skills. Must be able to keep organized, accurate records of daily activities and results. Strong organizational skills imperative. Can acquire and integrate industry knowledge related to general trends, emerging technologies, & competitors. Must be able to manage sales funnel to analyze/ manage pipeline activity and monitor sales against assigned quotas. Develop sales plans and strategies to achieve agreed upon goals of company. Essential Skills and Qualifications:·         5 years of experience selling IT services and solutions sales to State, Local, government agencies. •     Must have a demonstrated track record interfacing with IT managers, understanding their needs, documenting requirements, and working with corporate staff in designing a cost effective solution in closing the sale.•     Proven track record of generating new business through prospecting efforts and expanding opportunities through existing relationships. •    Deep past customer relationships and experiences in several key target accounts within various State Government Agencies Well versed in selling IT solutions, preferably solutions pertaining to the design, development, and integration of web applications Experienced in selling IT Services that includes and not limited to: Big Data & Data Science, Mobility Solutions, Software Quality Assurance and Testing, Staff Augmentation Demonstrated commitment to teamwork and account results. •     BA/BS degree or equivalent System Soft Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/V/D. If interested, please send your resume and a brief cover letter with REF# SST-KK-0809-1 your salary expectations and availability to jeremy.billie@sstech.usHelp

Title: Data Architect
Description:
About the Job
        
                                    Must be a US Citizen who currently possesses a Top Secret Clearance.                        Statement of Work:      The client understands the objectives of the FBI's Facilities Logistics and Services Division and Finance Division (FLSD/FD) to establish processes, architecture, technology and talent to employ the current enterprise data warehouse environment, Financial Information Repository Environment (FIRE) as a basis of information management and provider for analytical services to the enterprise. The objective of this work order is to establish not only the architecture and related processes for maintaining and optimizing FIRE but also to extend the architecture to include analytical services technology that will employ and grow data within FIRE.Task Description:Data Warehouse Services:The government is seeking to leverage the current FIRE environment and tools to support analytics. This includes enhancing and expanding the FIRE data processing, data dissemination, and data delivery capabilities based on findings from data analytic efforts. As reflected in the design document, FIRE is a complex system with many components dependent on one another. This is particularly true for the extract/transform/load (ETL) processes. Data from disparate data sources must move through a number of ETL zones (e.g., landing, staging zone, data warehouse (DW), reporting) before it can be used effectively. Performing analytics may require modifications/enhancements including the creation of new data structures, new ETL processes and new data dissemination solutions. The addition of new components could affect existing components and must be addressed carefully.Advanced Analytic Capabilities:Analytical capabilities in the analytics platform enable data scientists and business analysts to create advanced analytical models, access data, and present the findings to line of business and executive users through interactive dashboards, reports and scorecards. Greater efficiency and effectiveness of the analytics platform and data management comes from defining and establishing processes for addressing inter-related disciplines across people, process, and technology with a holistic, aligned and comprehensive approach.Our analytics environment will bring the right tools and technology such as SPSS Modeler, R, ETL, Web Focus, and other government approved tools for assisting data analytics capabilities, establishing and maintaining the data analytics processes, environments and services.Data Architect:Duties are to design, develop, and enhance conceptual, logical and physical data models for diverse set of data in a variety of repositories. Develop data models and an overall data infrastructure to address both identified and potential organizational requirements. Develop a robust architecture that meets the business requirements of the organization. Shall possess experience with defining, designing, building, and maintaining databases. Possess the ability to understand the business needs and strike a good balance between the business needs and technical implications.

Title: Assistant Director, Analytics and Decision Support**
Description:
About the Job
        
                  Closing Date: August 21, 2017  Excelsior College, a regionally accredited, virtual, private, nonprofit institution of higher learning is seeking dynamic applicants for the position of Assistant Director within the Analytics and Decision Support unit.         Summary    The Assistant Director is responsible for understanding business processes and managing the development and use of dashboards and reports that provide data to support decision making across the college. He or she assists business users in determining their data needs and provides guidance in the use of relevant data for decision making. The Assistant Director is expected to maintain extensive knowledge of business processes and data needs in an area of specialty as well as broad knowledge of processes college wide.      Responsibilities    Develop and maintain substantial expertise in the use of Excelsior’s decision support system to answer ad hoc questions and guide usage of others across the college    Collect and document business needs; design dashboards and other decision support applications accordingly    Use visual data tools to present data clearly to nontechnical audiences    Work closely with Business Intelligence developers, Data Scientist, and Senior Research Analysts to ensure that applications and reports meet business needs and are also intuitive and user friendly    Prepare and present data to various audiences using tables, charts, and narrative reports    Report on key performance indicators and create projections that support budget development    Identify challenges, threats, and inefficiency, and recommend solutions; work with the entire ADS team to promote consistency in analytical methodology    Promote data stewardship and data quality    Develop and maintain a broad and deep knowledge of business processes and data needs in an area of specialty as well as familiarity with the uses of data to make decisions throughout the college.    Other duties as assigned      Qualifications    Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution required (Master’s strongly preferred) in social science, psychology, mathematics, business or other quantitative discipline with relevant coursework in statistics and research methods    Five or more years relevant work experience    Expertise with Microsoft Office (particularly Excel and Word) and statistical software (such as SPSS, SAS, or R)    Experience with relational database products such as MS Access is desirable    Experience in higher education, particularly in an institutional research/institutional effectiveness office, is highly preferable    Proficient with enterprise reporting tools such as Qlik or Tableau    Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively and positively convey    institutional performance information    Analytical mindset and comfort with explaining quantitative analyses    Attention to detail, thoroughness, and follow through    Skill and experience with descriptive statistics and large data sets

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the Job
        
                                    This is a unique opportunity to join Enterprise G& Data Analytics team. The team was formed to lead both, analytics strategy and project-based solutions, focusing on the company's most critical business areas.  The focus of the group is to create dashboards that capture and visualize data to improve decision making to solve business problems, drive savings, and improve efficiency. This is a senior role that will provide insight into leading analytic practices and methods, design and lead iterative development and learning cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions to be leveraged by multiple Business Units.  The person in this role will be responsible for data architecture planning and for designing and building effective data models from multiple data sources.  Sr. BI Engineer will work with a wide variety of users throughout all Business Units to understand the problems that business is looking to solve. This role will collaborate with Data Analytics Governance board to evolve and enforce policies and standards regarding business intelligence initiatives.Responsibilities                                Work with cross-functional teams to Client and develop actionable, high-impact data analytics need and opportunity statements in a variety of core business areas. Coordinate with other team members but take accountability for overall delivery of Data Analytics projects.                                      Support applications in production.                                      Deliver regular reports to functional managers on project status.                                      Manage issue resolution and escalation within both IT and functional areas. Title: Business Unit Controller Senior
Description:
About the Job
        
                 Position OverviewThe Business Unit Controller Senior role will be part of the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP & A) group within Single Family (SF) Finance CFO department that supports the Pricing, Sourcing and CRT areas of the SF Business. The FP&A team is responsible for developing, generating, analyzing reports related to the Single Family business and helping support business decisions across our business partners. Single Family FP&A team engages business areas across the company to track and report on trends that impact overall Single Family business.  This team is also responsible for measuring and reporting SF Capital and Profitability (ROE) on a quarterly basis to FHFA.Responsibilities include:• Develop, use and/or analyze quantitative models that assess the market, credit and/or operational risks of new and existing financial and mortgage products or portfolios to support business and risk decisions.• Develop, validate or evaluate model input, methodology, implementation and output of models or analytic applications.• Plan, execute, and document complex financial models.• Provide model use risk assessments based on findings.• Provide modeling and analytical assistance to a line of business or product area, functioning as day-to-day technical expert.• Evaluate and manage risks associated with the company's models and/or model applications.• Perform detailed model validation reviews, establishing performance thresholds, researching model approaches, creating alternative models and other means.• Explain to stakeholders how a model and model process operates, what risks are inherent in the model or model process, and what controls exist to mitigate those risks.• May interact with senior customer personnel on significant technical matters frequently requiring coordination across organizational lines.• Work on multi-disciplinary projects with a strong customer focus• Customer, Segment and total Single Family level reporting and analyticsQualifications•      5- 7 years of experience with economic and/or financial modeling•     Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in data science, applied mathematics, economics, physics, econometrics, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline•     Experience with modern econometric/statistics estimation techniques; programming in SAS,R,MATLAB and/or C++; and, working with large data setsPreferred Skills• Master’s degree, Ph.D. or foreign equivalent in data science, applied mathematics, economics, physics, econometrics, finance, engineering, statistics, or computer science or related quantitative discipline• 3 years of experience with economic and/or financial modeling, which includes experience with: modern econometric/statistics estimation techniques; programming in SAS, R, MatLab and/or C++; and, working with large data sets• 5-7 years of experience in a business analysis role (business process, data, forecasting, research, testing, etc.)• Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access• Experience with mortgage and financial services industries• Understanding of SFP data and ex ante profitability results• Proven ability to learn new business concepts and skills quickly• Self-starter/independent thinker: demonstrated ambition to take on new roles with increasing responsibility with limited guidance and direction• Proficiency with MicroStrategy• Analytical thinking; able to amass and analyze large volumes of dataClosing StatementToday, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others. Freddie Mac is an equal opportunity and top diversity employer. EOE, M/F/D/V.

Title: Marketing Analytics Analyst
Description:
About the Job
        
                DescriptionACCOUNTABILITIES: • Leads and manages the development of a holistic cross-functional A&I point of view to address specified ad hoc cross-brand and/or cross-functional business questions that require the integration of output from marketing analytics, sales analytics, forecasting, decision science, and primarily market research. Creates value by adding own and synthesizing groups’ insights.• Works with senior staff managers to identify internal and external resource requirements and negotiates resources to meet ad hoc brand team needs. Works with Brand Director to make trade-offs in previous work plans to accommodate new project. • Represents any level of Sr. Management Staff as appropriate on internal committees or external team (e.g. business partners) meetings and communications. Suggests content for agendas, prepares and delivers presentations to address information needs and provides perspective to decisions at hand. • Leads the development and implementation of project plans for detailed, comprehensive secondary market data analyses across the portfolio in one of the following work streams: promotion response analytics, marketing mix modeling, segmentation schema, customer targeting or other related analyses. Recommends courses of action to support executive decision making in strategic business planning activities. • Maintains awareness of evolving analytical techniques, software and data sources to bring innovative approaches into the organization that drives higher quality results; designs and implements advanced secondary data analysis methodologies that provide best practices in these areas. • Functions independently as a “data scientist”; uses the scientific method to uncover business insights by asking challenging business questions, developing hypotheses around them, conducting data experiments, analyzing the results and drawing conclusions from the work to provide actionable intelligence to brand teams. • Prepares and delivers presentations with meaningful implications, actionable insights and recommendations which clearly delineate pros and cons to senior executive leadership in a timely manner. • Leads and conducts marketing analytics projects for multiple brand teams, and usually will support at least one brand marketed as part of an alliance partnership. • If outsourcing is appropriate, manages relationships with vendors on analytic plans, methodologies, and final deliverables. • Mentors analysts and associate analysts to ensure development of an appropriate skill set. set. • Able to use deep breadth of analytics and market knowledge to guide strategy decisions by brand directors and provide support for those decisions in discussions with senior executives. Demonstrates deep expertise in at least one brand and has the business framework to leverage knowledge base from all brand experiences to support other brands as necessary. Education and Experience: • BA or BS in an analytical field such as statistics, operations research, management science, industrial engineering, economics, math, etc. and 6+ years of quantitative experience or market research; or advanced degree in an analytical field such as statistics, operations research, management science, industrial engineering, economics, math, etc. and 4+ years of quantitative experience or market research. • 2+years pharmaceutical market research experience preferred. • Complete understanding and application of quantitative principles, concepts, practices, and standards surrounding the use and manipulation of secondary market data sources. • Extensive knowledge of market research principles and practices. • Extensive knowledge of industry practices. • Project planning and management skills. • Knowledge of coding techniques in SAS and VBA, and advanced Excel skills. • Excellent communication and presentation skills. • Vendor and budget management. • Basic people and team management skills including measuring and delivering performance feedback. • Resource Management; ability to manage internal and external resources (people, information, technologies, time, and capital); allocates resources appropriately, given organization, group and individual goals and objectives to align with business goals. • Proficient in one or more of MS Office, MS Access, VBA, SPSS, or SAS programming.

This is a contract for hire opportunity. Must be able to work onsite in Topeka. Client offers a great work environment (work life balance, career advancement, flexibility, team mentality). Upon conversion to perm client offers a very competitive base salary plus bonus (10%), excellent benefits to include 26 days vac/sick/holiday 1st yr, 401k company match is up to 4.5% dollar for dollar, Retirement plan on top of 401k, Excellent Med/Dental/Vision plan, LT/ST disability insurance, training/education, and more….Summary of Primary Duties and Responsibilities:The Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Program provides enterprise support for our companies capability to derive value from information assets by providing data accessibility, support for analytic tools and administration of program standards. The EDW Program requires significant levels of collaboration with peers and business partners to enable the creation of data insights, decision support solutions and actionable information.The Report and Analytic (R&A) Developer will report to the Enterprise Data Warehouse Supervisor. The R&A Developer is responsible for creation of data insights, decision support solutions and actionable information using standard EDW Program methods, tooling and processes. The R&A Developer assist with the administration of EDW Program’s portals and repositories.Job functions include, but are not limited to:Intake, assessing and documenting of reporting and analytic Report and Analytic (R&A) requestsProvides R&A solution guidance to business partners; recommend the right tool for the jobWorks with business to define and documents R&A deliverablesObtains standard/proper data interpretation from data stewardsDefines R&A data gaps in terms of software functionality or data accessibility requirementsDevelops reports, analytics and dashboardsUtilizes standard R&A delivery patterns for documentation and testingProvides training on Data Lake, Data Warehouse and standard enterprise analytic and business intelligence softwareMaintains production support service levels - incident and break/fix ticketsAdministrates analytics and business intelligence portal/repository configurationsAdministrates user access to portal/repository/data in accordance with standard user permissions protocolParticipates in upgrades of analytic and business intelligence software, portals and repositoriesMaintains software and solution documentation in the enterprise CMDBMaintains inventory of IT developed and supported reports, analytics and dashboardsCoordinates with other IT teams and business units as requiredEducation and Experience Requirements:A bachelor degree in business, finance, accounting, mathematics, engineering is preferred.  Requires three years of relevant experience. Relevant experience includes data analytics, data science, report writing or business intelligence.Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities Required:This position is responsible for the creation of data insights, decision support solutions and actionable information. This work is technical and requires a high degree of knowledge in the manipulation, interpretation and visual representation of data. This position also requires the ability to administrate reporting, analytics, and business intelligence software, portals and repositories. Knowledge in analytical method, data manipulation, data visualization and software administration is critical. In addition, the following attributes are required for the position.Proficient in the navigation of data (structured and unstructured)Read and develop SQL, T-SQL or PL/SQLExperienced with modern self-service analytic softwareExperienced with traditional business intelligence softwareGood experience working with one or more tools like Tableau, Power BI, SSRS, Data Visualizer, Crystal Reports, Qlik/Qlikview/Qlik Sense, Tibco/SpotfireHighly organized; balancing competing priorities, milestones and deadlinesStrong verbal and written communications on a wide variety of business and technical topicsStrong relationship and customer service skillsTranslate business needs into solution deliverables and software recommendationsUnderstand and interpret complex dataAdapt to quickly changing methods, technologies, software and business requirementsAbility to transform data into information and create visually intuitive and meaningful illustrations (analytical mindset)Ability to create innovative solutions for challenging data and visualizationLeadership and initiative in building an enterprise analytics mindsetLeadership in the evolution and merging of technologies to ease creation and use of analyticsDocumentation of work planning and executionGive formal/informal presentations to technical and non-technical staff

Title: IBU Finance and Actuarial Manager
Description:
About the Job
        
                The Individual Business Unit (IBU) is seeking an experienced and highly motivated manager to lead the Performance and Sustainability team. The ideal candidate will have a well-rounded mix of actuarial and financial experience and will be able to combine strong analytical and data modeling skills with a high degree of business acumen to drive solutions and develop insights. This role works closely with IBU partners across the organization from Actuarial, Finance, Product, Sales and Marketing, Operations, Corporate Strategy/Planning, HCV/WCM, Tessellate and ONHR and should have a proven track record of leveraging business relationships to drive cross-functional collaboration. Strong communications skills are a must including the ability to effectively communicate financial performance and strategic imperatives through PowerPoint presentations, dashboards, and reports to a diverse range of audiences including senior leadership.  The IBU Performance and Sustainability Manager will be responsible for the following: Direct a cross-functional team to develop IBU’s multi-year pricing strategy for each annual product development cycle to ensure IBU is on a path to achieve the segment’s long-term membership and margin targets.  Balance tradeoffs between membership and margin in setting pricing for IBU’s entire product portfolio. The ability to think strategically and with an eye to the competitive landscape in setting pricing relativities, area factors, network relativities and other pricing factors is key to success in the role. Forecast IBU membership and individual market size for utilization in setting corporate targets, pricing IBU’s products, developing business plans, allocating resources, and for setting IBU’s budget.  Work with Actuarial and Finance in forecasting IBU’s financial results through the Capital Plan process. Develop business cases and perform cost/benefit financial analysis related to IBU business decisions and emerging regulatory issues. Lead an Advanced Analytics team that is responsible for data analysis and predictive modeling. Partner with stakeholders on predictive modeling requests both within the segment and within the broader organization, as well as working with external vendors. Manage the relationship with IBU’s internal Informatics team to ensure IBU has access to necessary membership, claims, profitability, and other data needed for analytical purposes. Use a data and analytically driven approach to monitor results vs. targets, identify problems quickly, and develop recommended solutions. Develop actionable insights and drive monthly, quarterly, and “real-time” reporting during the open enrollment period (OEP) related to IBU performance from a membership and margin perspective.  Review and work with business partners to take the detailed information and develop simple and concise explanations of financial changes and implications. Create executive-level presentations related to topics such as competitive pricing, IBU’s pricing strategy, and IBU’s financial performance. Work with Tessellate, IBU’s risk adjustment vendor, to manage the risk adjustment submission process and drive revenue enhancement initiatives. Support the relationship with Health Care Value (HCV) and Wellness Care Management (WCM) to implement, monitor and optimize benefit cost savings initiatives and network solutions for the individual market. Partner with the Financial Performance and Management (FPM) team to track and monitor IBU financial performance and develop insights that support senior leadership in running the business and producing actionable results. Other duties may be assigned.DEPARTMENT REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor's Degree in related field required. Degrees in actuarial science, finance, or data science are highly preferred. Five (5) years experience in related field including analytical experience in a leadership role.  Five (5) years experience in strategic roles driving financial and/or actuarial results. Ability to lead cross-functional teams including Actuarial, Finance, Product, Sales, Marketing, Corporate Strategy/Planning, Office of National Health Reform (ONHR), Tessellate/Enterprise Risk Adjustment, Health Care Value (HCV) and Wellness Care Management (WCM) teams. Strong management skills capable of motivating, managing, and developing a team with a wide breadth of skillsets required. Ability to conduct cost benefit analysis and forecast future impacts to the business based on changing market dynamics. Excellent problem solving, analytical, project and process skills required. Strong decision analysis capabilities. Advanced skills with the Microsoft Office suite of products, especially Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word. Working knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide and Visual Analytics is preferred. Ability to work with large datasets and obtain data from various SQL server or enterprise data stores. Ability to think strategically and contemplate how solutions will impact not just the segment, but also the enterprise as a whole. Working knowledge of individual health care reform and existing Affordable Care Act (ACA) regulation preferred. Experience with BCBSM internal data stores such as EDW, CADE, MRDM, and FACETS strongly preferred. Proven experience in developing analytical and financial models with applied business outcomes such as life-time value models, regression/time-series models, clustering techniques, and membership/market forecasting models. Development of complex models to project membership across many dimensions. Excellent problem solving, analytical, project and process skills required. Ability to understand and apply statistical inference. Strong consulting, leadership and negotiation skills. Strong oral, written and communication skills. Highly self-driven and self-motivated. Ability to work under general direction. Ability to work effectively in a team environment. Extensive knowledge of corporate organizational structure, including functional responsibilities. Comprehensive understanding of all BCBSM's products, programs, administrative policies and procedures. Highly developed interpersonal skills. Other related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this job.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other grounds, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.

About the Job
        
                JOB DESCRIPTION Federate Systems is looking for a strong Systems Architect and Engineering SME to support one of our federal clients. Selected candidate would provide technical engineering, including requirements definition, conceptual design, prototype and pilot implementation, and assessment of the infrastructure and emerging technology services.  The required resource will provide the Office of the Chief Information Officer with engineering support for IT architecture and technologies, including but not limited to:   •         Development of Technical Architecture and Strategic Roadmap (TASR).  Strategic Planning and Road Map development. •         Architectural requirements definition, design, development and integration •         Assessment of the impact of the introduction of new and emerging technical solutions such as but not limited to Cloud Computing Initiatives, Compute, Data Storage, Security•         Assessment and feedback on related strategies such as back-up, storage as a service, and others•         Assessment of threat response and security posture•         Information Assurance in regards to security assessment and compliance•         Analysis for Open Data initiatives and for software management initiatives following the requirements from the OMB M-16-12 directive, FIATARA and related guidance•         Recommended architecture and infrastructure improvements, and associated requirements definition.•         Cloud Services•         Infrastructure•         Disaster Recovery•         Digital Asset Management•         Network & Cyber Security Main Activities:  •         Provide written assessments of the architecture and infrastructure and associated recommendations related to the above mentioned tasks which detail associated physical and logical architecture requirements, including physical and logical architecture block diagrams, narrative descriptions, design allocation requirements, preliminary schedule and cost estimates.•         Develop Enterprise Architecture and Infrastructure as directed. Define the technology deficiencies between the current and target architectures.•         Complete pilot and prototype system and component design, development, and implementation documentation artifacts as directed.  Perform architecture and engineering tasks related to the development of major IT Modernization projects.  Create “target” views of the information requirements, flows, and infrastructure and emerging technology solutions.•         Provide rapid response architecture and engineering support to the Technical Programs, Customer Advocacy, and Enterprise Services organizations as needed.•         Provide technical leadership for Technology Working Groups (TWG) and the associated process in the selection of department wide standards and technology products. •         Define requirements, selection criteria, write recommendations for products, service and standards selection, and assure their appropriate incorporation into the TRM.•         Conduct ongoing investigations of near- and long-term computer technologies and provide strategic analysis and recommendations. SPECFIC SKILLS REQUIRED: •         System Architecture and Engineering Computer Science education, experience in all life cycle phases -- requirements, design, development, integration.•         Knowledge of the existing environment and technology is a plus•         Strong task orientation, ability to work independently, and strong architecture consultant skills.•         Advanced and comprehensive network and security Infrastructure, cloud computing, and advanced and emerging development with new technologies. •         Complete understanding and past experience with the following but not limited to: Cloud, Unified Communications, Disaster Recovery, Infrastructure, Data And Data Standards, Digital Asset Management, Data Science, Network / Cyber Security, Strategic Planning and Roadmap development.   If interested, please submit your MS Word formatted resume for review to recruiter at federatesystems.com.

About the Job

Applicants should place their narrative information in the Cover Letter / Other Professional Details field.Pay, Benefits, & Work SchedulePROMOTION OPPORTUNITY: Promotion opportunities allow applicants at all band levels to be considered.  Qualifications for NGA positions do not include specific time-in-band requirements.  NGA will emphasize quality of experience, rather than duration, and assess how the quality of the experience demonstrates possession of the knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies necessary for successful job performance in the NGA occupational structure.Band 03   $60,613 - $123,234Band 04   $86,391 - $145,629PERMANENT CHANGE IN STATION: PCS expenses are authorized.Pay is only part of the compensation you will earn working for the Federal Government. We offer a broad array of benefits programs and family friendly flexibilities to meet the needs of you and your family.For more information on the array of benefits programs, please visit  https://www.intelligencecareers.gov/nga/ngabenefits.html DutiesONLY ELECTRONIC SUBMISSIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED.Additional Position InfoADDITIONAL INFORMATION: NGA seeks Data Analyst who understands data, how to view it, manipulate it, influence it and analyze it to support missions such as National Intelligence, National Security, Military Operations, Military Planning, and Disaster Relief and Preparedness for a diverse audience including the Department of Defense, the Intelligence Community, and senior US and foreign government officials up to and including The United States Congress and the President of the United States. The Data Analyst will be part of a multi-disciplinary team constructed to use design and computational thinking to find scalable solutions to the Agency's most challenging and highest priority problems sets.Band 03: Data Analysts apply moderately complex tools and algorithms to identify trends and patterns in data. They communicate with stakeholders and conduct research to develop an intermediate understanding of relevant programs and requirements. These analysts identify and collect moderately structured data from various sources, evaluate the data to ensure that they meet analytic needs, and prepare the data for analysis. They also select, apply, and assess a variety of analytic models and techniques, and review and verify the results. They prepare reports and briefings and consult with stakeholders to communicate findings.* Analyze and interpret statistical data to identify trends or relationships among variables and factors that could affect the results of research* Apply mathematical principles or statistical approaches to solve moderately complex problems in scientific or applied fields* Prepare statistical reports, to include graphics or other visual representations of informationBand 04: Data Analysts lead efforts to apply complex tools and algorithms to identify trends and patterns in data. They communicate with stakeholders and conduct research to develop a comprehensive understanding of relevant programs and requirements. These analysts identify and collect unstructured data from various sources, evaluate the data to ensure that they meet analytic needs, and prepare the data for analysis. They also select, apply, and assess advanced analytic models and techniques, and review and verify the results. They lead the preparation of reports and briefings and consult with stakeholders to communicate findings.* Analyze and interpret statistical data and communicate the identified trends or relationships among variables and factors that could affect the results of research* Apply mathematical principles or statistical approaches to solve complex problems in scientific or applied fields* Identify the proper techniques and reports necessary to present results of analyses to intended audiencesHighly Desired SkillsQUALIFICATION CRITERIA: In addition to the mandatory qualifications, experience in the following is desired:1) Education: Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Geographic Information Science, Informatics and Computing, Information Science, Operations Research, Statistics, or a related discipline;2) Experience: Software Coding: C++ Java, AND/OR Statistics & Modelling: R, Python, AND/OR Query Languages: SQL, NoSQL, AND/OR Scripting: JavaScript, Python, Cloud Services Design, Algorithm Development, Data Visualization, Big Data /Data Modelling, Machine Vision & Deep Learning, Optimization.How To Apply - ExternalApplication submission involves applying using the Intelligence Community's Applicant Gateway on-line application process.ONLY ELECTRONIC SUBMISSIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED.NotesAs a condition of employment at NGA, persons being considered for employment must meet NGA fitness for employment standards.- U.S. Citizenship Required- Security Clearance (Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information)- Polygraph Test Required- Position Subject to Drug Testing- Two Year Probationary Period- Direct Deposit RequiredHow Will I Be Evaluated?APPLICANT EVALUATION PROCESS: Applicants will be evaluated for this job opportunity in three stages:1) All applicants will be evaluated using the Mandatory Qualification Criteria,2) Qualified applicants will then be evaluated by an expert or panel of experts using a combination of qualification criteria to determine the best-qualified candidates,3) Best-qualified applicants may then be further evaluated through an interview process.Applicants are encouraged to carefully review the Assignment Description, Additional Information Provided By the Selecting Official, and the Qualification Requirements; and then construct their resumes to highlight their most relevant and significant experience and education for this job opportunity. This description should include examples that detail the level and complexity of the performed work. Applicants are encouraged to provide any education information referenced in the announcement. If education is listed as a mandatory requirement, only degrees obtained from an institution accredited by an accrediting organization recognized by the Secretary, US Department of Education will be accepted.In accordance with section 9902(h) of title 5, United States Code, annuitants reemployed in the Department of Defense shall receive full annuity and salary upon appointment. They shall not be eligible for retirement contributions, participation in the Thrift Savings Plan, or a supplemental or redetermined annuity for the reemployment period. Discontinued service retirement annuitants (i.e., retired under section 8336(d)(1) or 8414(b)(1)(A) of title 5, United States Code) appointed to the Department of Defense may elect to be subject to retirement provisions of the new appointment as appropriate. (See DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 300, at  http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives .)All candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or sexual orientation.NGA provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Applications will only be accepted online. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify us at recruitment@nga.milHelp   The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be on a case-by-case basis.DCIPS DisclaimerNGA utilizes all processes and procedures of the Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). Non-executive NGA employees are assigned to five distinct pay bands based on the type and scope of work performed. The employee's base salary is established within their assigned pay band based on their unique qualifications. A performance pay process is conducted each year to determine a potential base pay salary increase and/or bonus. An employee's annual performance evaluation is a key factor in the performance pay process. Employees on term or temporary appointments are not eligible to apply for internal assignment opportunity notices.This position is a DCIPS position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601.  DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to preference eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are an external applicant claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you must self-identify your eligibility in your application.This position is funded by the National Intelligence Program (NIP).Additional Job RequirementsYou must be able to obtain and retain a Top Secret security clearance with access to Sensitive Compartmented Information. In addition, you are subject to a Counterintelligence Polygraph examination in order to maintain access to Top Secret information. All employees are subject to a periodic examination on a random basis in order to determine continued eligibility. Refusal to take the examination may result in denial of access to Top Secret information, SAP, and/or unescorted access to SCIFs.Employees with SCI access and who are under NGA cognizance are required to submit a Security Financial Disclosure Report, SF-714, on an annual basis in order to determine continued eligibility. Failure to comply may negatively impact continued access to Top Secret information, Information Systems, SAP, and/or unescorted access to SCIFs.

Title: Principal Solution Architect - Cloud IAAS/PAAS
Description:
About the Job
        
                We are a Stealth mode startup based in Fremont that is developing a revolutionary storage and compute acceleration platform using deep learning and machine learning.  Our platform runs on standard hardware and handles low-level implementation details so data scientists/developers can be more productive!  The platform can scale to thousands of FPGA and ASIC devices and can virtualize the computer power required for cloud scale applications.Top Reasons to Work with UsAs the Principal Solution Architect, you will be instrumental to drive application level technical engagement with DC customers/partners to facilitate the creation of the right acceleration solutions. You must have application level expertise in one or more of the following domains: Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Big Data Analytics, Transcoding, NoSQL database, NVMe Flash / Storage Class Memory, and/or Virtualization. If you are someone who's fascinated by the rapidly-evolving cloud application acceleration space, we should talk.What You Will Be Doing•Assist field business development in guiding the customer through the sales process, owning the technical relationship and assisting customers in building innovative solutions •Be an industry thought leader on integrating our technology into data center architectures to support various applications especially in Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Database, or Transcoding domains•Propose solution architecture to meet DC customer performance, scalability, reliability, and security needs•Execute customer-specific POC / demo / benchmarking activities to accelerate design wins and revenueWhat You Need for this Position•Assist field business development in guiding the customer through the sales process, owning the technical relationship and assisting customers in building innovative solutions •Be an industry thought leader on integrating our technology into data center architectures to support various applications especially in Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Database, or Transcoding domains•Propose solution architecture to meet DC customer performance, scalability, reliability, and security needs•Execute customer-specific POC / demo / benchmarking activities to accelerate design wins and revenueWhat's In It for You•BS in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science. MS or Ph.D. desirable•2 years of work related experience in Deep Learning / Machine learning or 10+ years architecture experience in software development, database, and/or high-performance computing•Deep understanding of Cloud IAAS / PAAS workloads•Experience with use of workload accelerators (FPGA / GPU / ASIC) and associated hardware, software, and interface requirements•Familiarity with industry efforts to develop accelerator interfaces and software frameworks (OpenCAPI, CCIX, Gen-Z)•5+ years management experience and demonstrated ability to lead a high energy solution architect team•Experience with Deep Learning frameworks and tools e.g. Caffe, TensorFlow, MxNet or other Deep Learning Frameworks•C/C++/Python programming / Parallel programming experienceSo, if you are a Principal Solution Architect with experience, please apply today!

Title: Lead Software Engineer - JAVA/Backend Development
Description:
About the Job
        
                We are a small group of crazy engineers who are bold enough to think that we can build better AI and communications apps than armies of engineers from Google and Microsoft.   We are a well-funded startup in Palo Alto, bringing artificial intelligence to workplace communications, starting with email. In March 2017, we launched our Public Beta, intelligent email apps for Mac & iOSTop Reasons to Work with UsWe are seeking a senior/staff server engineering team member, experienced in Java, with a broad range of back-end skills, including ideally expertise or interest in search, data science, sync or messaging technologies.You'll be one of the first hires onto our team of senior developers. Among our 11 team members, several have previously been company founders or founding engineers.You'll need to be comfortable in a high-performing team -- collaborating, contributing, learning, leading -- in a fast-paced early stage (and well-funded) startup. We're collaborative in discussing what we're architecting & building, and we have a relaxed but productive workplace & style.The startups in which we've been co-founders and founding engineers have had several successful outcomes, such as multiple acquisitions ranging from $100M to $850M. Along with those startups (or as a result of them) we've also worked at Google, VMware, LinkedIn, Cisco, BEA and Stanford University.What You Will Be DoingAs a company, we run lean (although we provide top-notch healthcare, and a couple other interesting benefits), to ensure we have plenty of runway to achieve our ambitions, and nearly every dollar we spend goes into (a) hiring & compensating great people, and (b) ensuring we have the software & hardware to be productive & satisfied in our work.Our expectation is that anyone joining us now as a senior engineer would in the future be a founder/co-founder of her or his own company.The sponsoring partner at our VC firm is also a successful founder (having founded and sold an enterprise software company for $350M) an accomplished engineering leader, and passionately engaged in our vision.What You Need for this Position•5+ years of experience with Java/Python and a broad range of backend skills•CS degree is a MUST•Expertise/Interest in Data Science, Sync or messaging technologiesSo, if you are a Lead Server Engineer with experience, please apply today!
